title:
Manipulation and trapping of magnetic skyrmions with domain walls in
  chiral magnetic thin films
abstract:
In this article we use chiral domain walls to manipulate and trap magnetic
skyrmion quasi-particles in chiral magnetic materials such as ultrathin Co/Pt
films. The magnetic skyrmions can be orientated such that their interaction
with domain walls is repulsive, allowing for them to be stored between domain
walls. In certain orientations, the skyrmion can be absorbed into the domain
wall, forming a domain wall kink. In other orientations, it can absorbed to
form a kink-antikink domain wall with zero topological charge. The magnetic
skyrmion can even be orientated in such a way that it remains trapped but
creates a topological defect-antidefect pair in one of the walls. By altering
the phases of one of the chiral domain walls, one can erase or store the
magnetic skyrmion as an isolated soliton or as a domain wall
skyrmion/antiskyrmion. This adds a valuable asset to an ever growing toolbox of
spintronic nano-devices.
